name: Instant Pot® Rutabaga Mash
author: France C
summary: This lower-carb alternative to mashed potatoes can easily be made in a fraction of the time using a pressure cooker.  The mash has a nice creamy and chunky texture, which complements any meat. I especially enjoy it with corned beef.
ingredients: 2 pounds rutabaga, peeled and chopped into 1-inch cubes
directions: Pour water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and set the trivet inside
Place rutabaga into a steamer basket and set inside the pot
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Return rutabaga to pot or place into a medium bowl
Add half-and-half, butter, salt, pepper, and garlic powder to the rutabaga and mash to desired consistency
The rutabaga will have a chunky texture
For a smoother texture, use a food processor
